Description: Body sherd of Chian pottery Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of lotus bud in added white outline with added red centre above two white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Aphrodite (Naukratis), Context Φ8
Curator's comments: Φ8 is written in pencil on the exterior surface of the sherd. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior (Williams 1983, 169) and many kantharoi Type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis.
Bibliographic references: Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p.168, no. 140)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 727, no. 866)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1745) (phase 2)
